page.title: 13HOME LIFE
page.content: The normal homelife of families are almost identical to any in Britain. Even meals are very similar with the extensive use of oats disappearing from the diet. The children's games have also changed with the times,most of the older games having died out.Firm favourites are Chinese skipping (jumping over a long loop of elastic held round the legs of 2 friends),hopscotch (once called hopping beddies) and a Gartly version of cricket. The old hoop (rim of cart wheel) has given way to a worn tyre. Roller boots (girls) and racer bikes (boys) are favoured today. T.V. games and computers are now more common. Many families are not active members of any church,though most would consider themselves Presbyterian. Some attend Gartly or Huntly churches.There are also some Roman Catholic families.
